label: Constitutional Failure
description: A condition in which a constitutional system formally persists but substantively fails to constrain power coordinate institutions or protect foundational commitments

label: Bad-Faith Constitutional Actors
description: Political or institutional actors who strategically exploit constitutional rules gaps or ambiguities for private or factional advantage rather than constitutional compliance

label: Elite Capture
description: A process through which constitutional institutions are systematically dominated or controlled by a narrow group undermining accountability and representative governance

label: Rule Subversion
description: The manipulation selective enforcement or reinterpretation of constitutional rules preserving legality while eroding substantive order

label: Fault Tolerance
description: A constitutional design principle enabling institutions to function under predictable failures including abuse non-compliance and bad-faith behavior

label: Constitutional Redundancy
description: Deliberate duplication or overlap of constitutional functions to prevent single-point failure or capture

label: Fallback Constitutional Mechanisms
description: Secondary or reserve constitutional processes activating when primary mechanisms fail or deadlock

label: Institutional Overlap
description: Partial sharing of constitutional authority enabling mutual monitoring and limiting power concentration

label: Nash Equilibrium (Constitutional Context)
description: A stable strategic configuration where actors lack unilateral incentive to defect from constitutional constraints

label: Self-Enforcing Constitutional Constraints
description: Constraints maintained by strategic incentives rather than moral commitment or external enforcement

label: Incentive Misalignment
description: A condition where constitutional rules generate incentives diverging from constitutional objectives

label: Power Fragmentation
description: Distribution of constitutional authority across multiple actors to limit domination and coordinated capture

label: Anti-Capture Constitutional Design
description: Design strategies structurally resisting elite capture through redundancy fragmentation and adversarial arrangements

label: Emergency Degradation
description: Tendency of constitutional safeguards to weaken or be bypassed under emergency or crisis conditions

label: Constitutional Resilience
description: Capacity of a constitutional system to absorb shocks resist capture and recover without collapse

label: Epistemic Stabilizer (NAC)
description: A mechanism preventing epistemic collapse by stabilizing interpretation and implementation of constitutional rules
notes: Derived from Core Paper NAC logic

label: National Equilibrium Fund (NEF)
description: A constitutional mechanism stabilizing strategic equilibrium and self-enforcing constraints nationally
notes: Derived from Core Paper NEF logic

label: 8-8-8 Symmetry Framework
description: A geometric institutional architecture distributing authority across mirrored executive legislative and judicial nodes

label: Compliance Trap
description: A structural vulnerability where constitutional survival depends on good-faith adherence actors have incentives to violate

label: Institutionalized Distrust (IDT)
description: A constitutional philosophy treating mutual distrust as a structural asset organizing adversarial monitoring and symmetric checks
notes: Theoretical core of Golden Phoenix Model
